GPTChat functionality¶

Chat’s views¶

class chat.views.chat_ai.ChatView(**kwargs)¶
get(request)¶

The get function is used to render the chat_ai.html page, which contains the chatbot interface.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • request – Get the request object

Returns:

The chat_ai.html render

post(request, messages=[])¶

The post function is used to handle the POST request from the user. It takes in a list of messages, which are stored as dictionaries with two keys: role and content. The role key can be either &quot;user&quot; or &quot;system&quot;, while the content key stores a string message. The post function then adds another dictionary to this list of messages, containing information about what was posted by the user (role = &quot;user&quot;) and what they wrote (content = whatever they typed). It then calls text_generator() on this updated list of messages, which returns a tuple containing two strings: response_role and response_

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • request – Get the message from the user

  • messages – Store the messages that have been sent to the chatbot

Returns:

A jsonresponse object, which is a subclass of httpresponse

class chat.views.text_correction.CorrectorView(**kwargs)¶
get(request)¶

The get function is called when a user navigates to the /chat/text_correction url. It renders the text_correction.html template, which contains a form for users to enter text into.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • request – Pass the request object to the view

Returns:

A rendered template chat/text_correction.html

post(request)¶

The post function is called when the user submits a message. The function takes in the request and returns a JsonResponse object with the response from chatbot_response.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the object itself

  • request – Get the message from the user

Returns:

A json response with the original message and the corrected message

Card’s services¶

chat.services.checking_sentences.text_generator(prompt)¶

The text_generator function takes a string as an argument and returns the same string with any spelling errors corrected.

Parameters:

prompt – Pass the text that needs to be corrected

Returns:

The corrected text

chat.services.conversation.chat_bot(messages)¶

The text_generator function takes in a list of messages and returns the role (speaker) and content (message) of the first response from OpenAI’s GPT-3 API. The function is used to generate responses to user input.

Parameters:

messages – Pass in the messages that you want to use as a prompt for your chatbot

Returns:

A tuple of the role and content
